title: Mexican Green Spaghetti
ingredients: 4 large green bell peppers, stemmed and seeded
1 cup water, or more as needed
1 tablespoon butter, or more to taste
1 cup shredded mozzarella cheese, or more to taste
method: Step 1: Bring a large pot of lightly salted water to a boil. Cook spaghetti in the boiling water, stirring occasionally, until tender yet firm to the bite, about 12 minutes. Drain and set aside.

Step 2: Combine bell peppers, water, chicken bouillon, and garlic in a medium pot. Bring to a boil, reduce heat, and cook until peppers are soft, 7 to 10 minutes. Remove from heat and let cool for a few minutes.
Step 3: Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C). Coat the bottom of a 9x13-inch baking dish with butter.

Step 4: Fill blender halfway with the pepper-broth mixture. Cover and hold lid down with a potholder; pulse a few times before leaving on to blend. Pour into a bowl. Repeat with any remaining mixture. Stir in sour cream.

Step 5: Line the bottom of the baking dish with a layer of the spaghetti. Spread a portion of the pepper puree on top and add a layer of mozzarella cheese. Repeat layering spaghetti, pepper puree, and cheese until all ingredients are used up.
Step 6: Bake in the preheated oven until cheese is melted, about 20 minutes.
Step 7: Use any kind of bell peppers you like. Seeding is optional. If not making this for kids, you can boil a jalapeno pepper with the bell peppers.

Step 8: You can also cover the dish with aluminum foil while it bakes to keep the noodles from crisping and burning. In that case, I wouldn't advise putting cheese on top; whenever I do that it doesn't taste as good...
